The string data type is used to represent textual data (i.e. sequences of characters). Strings are created using 'single' or "double quotes" surrounding one or more characters, as shown below:
You can include quotes inside the string as long as they don't match the enclosing quotes.

text: var a = "I’m going to the classroom"; // single quote inside double quotes

value: If you observe the above example, in variable a we have a sentence that is I’m going to the classroom, in this sentence if you see a single quote is there after I ,it won’t create a problem that is not matching with enclosing quotes because enclosing quotes are double quotes.
